content: Probably already discussed somewhere, but we have FHIR R3 while also reference it as v3.0.1 using version. As part of the publication discussions, will we be able to settle on one or the other? Would suggest to replace V with R so it does not confuse with V2 and V3 (the other product lines that is), which includes the column header on the published versions (i.e., release) page.

http://www.hl7.org/fhir/ - FHIR Release 3 (STU)
http://hl7.org/fhir/directory.html - Column header uses version. Then the STU 3 Sequence uses v3.0.0 in the description.
http://hl7.org/fhir/versions.html#versions - uses release and version
So is it FHIR R3.0.1 or FHIR R3 v3.0.1 or FHIR 3.0.1 etc?
I should change the directory list to say "Release 3 (STU) Sequence" instead of "STU 3 sequence". And we can change the versions page to describe releases more explicitly next time.
for now, we have Release 2, with a technical version of 3.0.1
